isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - TWO-SPEED AXLE (HYDRAULIC BRAKES WITH ELECTRIC SHIFTER)

svcproc.title: TWO-SPEED AXLE (HYDRAULIC BRAKES WITH ELECTRIC SHIFTER)
svcproc.para: The electrically operated two-speed shifter operates the same as the air operated described in this section except for the following:

step2.para: With the two-speed switch in the HI position, SF-1 relay is not energized and power from F14 fuse passes through the SF-1 relay terminal 30 to terminal 87 and to the two-speed motor at the "A" connector (see circuit diagram). This causes the axle to shift to the high mode.

With the two-speed axle in the LO position, SF-1 relay is energized by the WT ECU, and power from F14 fuse passes through SF-1 relay (terminal 30 to 87) and to the two-speed motor at the "C" connection (see circuit diagram). This causes the axle to shift to the low mode.
